intro: Glottiphyllum haagei, commonly known as the Cape mountain heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant features small, leathery leaves and produces clusters of bell-shaped flowers in shades of pink and white. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and conservation efforts.
